title: Leopard cub found dead in a shed in Nilambur
content: It is presumed that the mother leopard had brought the cub to the shed near a house. Forest officers attribute the death to natural causes

title: Greenpeace, civil society groups demand urgent action for making MSC pay for environment damage, livelihood loss
content: A White Paper outlines the potential ecological and socio-economic impacts of the shipwreck that occurred 14.6 nautical miles off the coast of Kochi on May 25. The paper terms the shipwreck’s consequences, including nurdle (plastic pellet) contamination along the coasts of Kerala, T.N. and Sri Lanka, as corporate negligence.

title: DGCA begins action against Air India for lapse in plane's emergency slide check
content: In a written reply, the Minister of State for Civil Aviation said that during the audit of Air India, DGCA found that the inspection of emergency slide was overdue

title: It does not behove Governor to say 'Himachal will become Udta Punjab': CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu
content: CM Sukhu said, "The Governor is holding a constitutional and dignified office and we respect him. But making such statements does not behove him. We should all respect the people of Himachal Pradesh"

title: Hyderabad | Prajavani WhatsApp grievance number 7416687878 receives 25 grievances in a day
content: Hyderabad collector Hari Chandana Dasari said that people can submit write their grievances, take a photo and send it over WhatsApp

title: CM Omar Abdullah visits family of Gujjar youth killed in police crossfire, assures justice
content: The Chief Minister called for an investigation into the incident and said that the use of force by police has to be calibrated and not “indiscriminate”

title: Monsoon rains in India 7% above normal but uneven across regions, shows IMD data
content: The country received 447.8 mm of rain against a normal of 418.9 mm during this period, with large variations between regions

title: Karnataka State Women’s Commission demands action against online trolling of former MP Ramya
content: The actress alleged that she was receiving abusive messages and threats from fans of Kannada actor, Darshan Thoogudeepa

title: Traders express disappointment over PM’s silence on Needamangalam-Vriddhachalam railway line
content: Kumbakonam All Traders’ Association was hoping that there will be announcement on Vriddhachala-Needamangalam railway line during the Prime Minister’s visit

title: Government school teacher accused of molesting over 20 students booked under Goondas Act in Ooty
content: Police received complaints from students during an awareness programme held to sensitise schoolchildren on sexual crimes

title: Army Chief visits Ladakh, reviews operational preparedness
content: Addressing the troops, Gen. Dwivedi underlined the need to embrace emerging technologies and continuously evolve to remain a future-ready force.

title: Naidu visits Singapore Sports School, announces bold push for sports-driven development in Andhra Pradesh
content: Chandrababu Naidu stated that the State has rolled out a comprehensive Sports Policy aimed at developing both talent and infrastructure while attracting investments

title: Net FDI has fallen steeply, domestic investors gripped by 'fear': Congress slams government
content: “The growth of mass markets for consumption goods is being hampered by a decade-long stagnant wages crisis and a flawed GST, which awaits fundamental reform,” Jairam Ramesh said

title: Booker winner Banu Mushtaq says caste remains India’s most brutal form of social control
content: In her address at Scholar in Campus programme at Kerala Media Academy, the Kannada writer says ‘hegemony of caste thrives not only through violence, but also through silence’

title: More than 31,500 government employees opt for UPS till July 20: Finance Ministry
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said as on July 20, 2025, at least 7,253 claims have been received and out of which 4,978 claims have been processed for payment of benefits under UPS

title: Rajya Sabha adjourned for day over SIR issue
content: When the Upper House reconvened at 2 p.m., the Chair tried to continue the debate on The Carriage of Goods by Sea Bill 2025; however, Opposition MPs continued pretesting regarding the SIR issue, and the Chair adjourned the House for the day

title: Mass inclusion, and not exclusion, should be the goal of the Bihar SIR, says Supreme Court
content: On the Election Commission’s remark that Aadhaar, EPIC, and ration card could be forged, SC says any document on Earth could be forged

title: Namakkal egg price falls to ₹4.50 after three months
content: Poultry owners said the price of egg was reduced owing to the festival season in six North Indian States as well as to prevent competition from other States

title: IT professionals in Kerala left in the lurch after TCS allegedly delays joining date
content: Techies who received formal offers from TCS speak of abrupt and indefinite onboarding delays without being given any clear reason

title: West Bengal’s 2002 SIR electoral roll appears on CEO site amidst speculations of fresh voter list revision
content: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari wrote to the CEC about a “surge” in the issuance and submission of voter registration forms and domicile certificates in West Bengal ahead of “prospective SIR”

title: Officials crackdown on black marketing of fertilizers in Vizianagaram district
content: We booked cases on two dealers and seized 3.74 lakh worth of fertilizers after observing malpractices in their shops, said District Agriculture officer

title: MSC Elsa 3 shipwreck: Greenpeace India, civil society groups seek action to make shipping firm pay relief for environmental damage, livelihood loss
content: White Paper outlines potential ecological and socio-economic impacts of the shipwreck that occurred 14.6 nautical miles off the coast of Kochi on May 25 and its consequences

title: Protests erupt in Kerala, Delhi over arrest of Keralite nuns in Chhattisgarh
content: Demonstrations assume a politically bipartisan character with ruling LDF and Opposition UDF MPs from Kerala simultaneously protesting outside Parliament, denouncing the arrests of the nuns on ‘trumped up’ charges

title: Cauvery river in spate, water enters low-lying areas in Erode’s Bhavani
content: The river enters Erode district at Nerinjipettai and flows through Ammapettai, Bhavani, Erode city and Kodumudi. A NDRF team is stationed in Bhavani and a SDRF team is camping at Erode city.

title: Visit to Singapore aims to set record straight, rebuild investor confidence: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: Chandrababu Naidu meets Singapore Minister Tan See Leng; pitches Andhra Pradesh as a hub for innovation, green energy, and logistics

title: Amaravati housing projects: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu seeks Singapore’s collaboration
content: CM Chandrababu Naidu observed that Singapore had already provided a master plan for the capital city and noted that the World Bank is also participating in the construction process

title: Madras High Court orders CBI probe into former BJP Yuva Morcha functionary’s murder in Puducherry
content: Justice P. Velmurugan directs Senior Superintendent of Police, Puducherry, to hand over the case files to the CBI forthwith

title: Ensure people are not harassed during revision of electoral rolls: Bengal CM tells officials
content: Mamata Banerjee announced that a dedicated scheme will be launched to assist the alleged persecuted Bengali migrants who have returned from other states

title: Muslim cleric booked for ‘objectionable’ remarks on Samajwadi Party MP Dimple Yadav
content: The remarks in question were allegedly made in response to Dimple Yadav's recent visit to a mosque, where the cleric reportedly commented inappropriately on her attire.

title: Vijay Shah remark row: Supreme Court raps M.P. Minister over public apology
content: In one of the previous sittings, the court had remarked that the Minister’s comments amounted to “crass, thoughtless remarks”

title: Bihar SIR: Trinamool Congress MP Saket Gokhale slams electoral roll revision; claims 1.26 crore voters 'deleted'
content: Saket Gokhale said the poll panel "conveniently" did not share any information regarding its claim of having found foreign nationals in Bihar

title: Debate on Operation Sindoor: Opposition running away from discussion, says Kiren Rijiju
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju said Parliament runs in accordance with rules and accused the Opposition of going back on its commitment and betraying everyone

title: Delhi High Court to hear pleas against Centre’s nod to release Udaipur Files film on July 30
content: The two petitions were listed before the High Court in pursuance to the Supreme Court’s direction to the petitioners to approach the high court against the Centre’s decision of giving nod for the film’s release

title: Supreme Court takes suo motu cognisance of report over dog bites leading to rabies
content: The Supreme Court Bench said every day, hundreds of dog bites were being reported in the city and on its outskirts, leading to rabies and ultimately, children and the aged were falling prey to the dreadful disease

title: Around 1,78,261 ha of compensatory afforestation raised; 85% of planned area achieved; gaps in fund use: CEC report
content: The report revealed that utilisation of funds under the Compensatory Afforestation Fund Management and Planning Authority varies sharply across States

title: Supreme Court stays Calcutta HC order on West Bengal OBC list
content: How can the High Court pass such an order? Reservation is part of the executive function, Supreme Court said

title: NCP(SP) MLA Rohit Pawar was in touch with BJP leaders: Minister Nitesh Rane
content: Nitesh Rane claimed that though Rohit Pawar is part of the Sharad Pawar-led NCP (Sharad Pawar), “his heart lies with the BJPs”

title: Supreme Court rejects Ilaiyaraaja’s plea for transfer of copyright case from Bombay HC to Madras HC
content: The counsel for Sony Music Entertainment told the Bench that the case by the firm was filed in the Bombay High Court when no case was pending in the Madras High Court

title: KUFOS Vice-Chancellor denies reports of sharing dais with RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: A. Bijukumar, in a statement, says he had attended an education seminar organised by Association of Indian Universities at Amrita Vidyapeetam

title: Sonia, Kharge, Rahul, Akhilesh join Opposition leaders in protest against SIR
content: There was a huge banner in front of them which read 'SIR- Attack on Democracy' as they lined up and staged a protest for the fifth consecutive day

title: Presidential Reference ‘misleading’, wants SC to sit on appeal against its own verdict in T.N. Governor case, says Kerala to Supreme Court
content: Kerala State pointed out that the Tamil Nadu Governor case judgment authored by Justice J.B. Pardiwala on April 8 has already addressed in detail the questions raised in the Presidential Reference in May

title: Supreme Court quashes FIR against shuttler Lakshya Sen in birth certificate forgery case
content: The case stems from a private complaint filed by M.G. Nagaraj who alleged that birth certificates of Lakshya Sen and his brother Chirag Sen were forged

title: Earth observation NISAR satellite will be launched on July 30, says ISRO chairman
content: NISAR-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar will observe earth with a swath of 242 km and high spatial resolution, using SweepSAR technology for the first time, according to the space agency

title: Siddappa Kambali Law College signs MoU with Mangaluru firm to provide exposure to students
content: Karnatak University Sir Siddappa Kambali Law College (KUSSK), Dharwad signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with SCLRSEA, VDMS Private Limited, Mangaluru

title: ‘Interpretations being presented as facts by a section of media’
content: Senior journalist says that ‘in the new models of media that are emerging, manufacturing consent seems to be a priority. This change has happened after journalism became an industry’

title: Karnataka MP says new amendment to Income Tax Act will impact services of Chartered Accountants
content: Member of Parliament G. Kumar Naik offers to raise the issue in the Lok Sabha if Chartered Accountants provide a detailed report on how the new amendment would impact their work

title: Bihar SIR row hearing updates: SC not to stop the publication of draft roll on August 1
content: A Bench of Justices Surya Kant and Joymalya Bagchi says  “it is only a draft” and does not take away the powers of the Supreme Court and says it would fix on July 29, the time schedule to conduct the final hearing of the matter.

title: SC hearing on Justice Varma’s petition updates: SC asks Sibal to place on record the fact-finding committee report, adjourns case to July 30
content: CJI B.R. Gavai’s willingness to judicially examine the question of Justice Varma’s removal comes days after the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha members initiated a removal motion and submitted notices on the same

title: Three patients die at Jalandhar civil hospital, families blame fault in oxygen supply
content: While the hospital said there was a dip in oxygen pressure because of a technical fault, it was rectified within no time

title: Five militants involved in extortion activity arrested in Manipur
content: Three active cadres of the banned Kangleipak Communist Party (Apunba City Meitei) were arrested from Imphal East district on July 27, 2025

title: 26th batch of 1,635 pilgrims leave Jammu for Amarnath Yatra
content: The 38-day pilgrimage to the 3,880-metre-high shrine, which commenced on July 3 from the valley, has recorded darshan of the ice lingam of Lord Shiva by more than 3.77 lakh pilgrims

title: Himachal Pradesh suffers losses of ₹1500 crore during ongoing monsoon season
content: So far, 88 people have died and 35 have gone missing in rain-related incidents, and 1,316 houses have been fully or partially damaged in the state

title: When all are treated equally, conflicts end, peace prevails, says Dingaleshwar Swami
content: The seer said that had it not been for Sufi saints and reformers like Basavanna and other sharanas, rivers of blood would have flown in the country

title: In Gujarat’s Amreli, a bedroom behind bars
content: A widowed farmer has formed a “human cage” to defend  the prowling leopards that stalk his rented farm, turning their lives into a nightly battle for survival

title: Police officers’ association condemns YSRCP leaders’ remarks
content: Former Minister Ambati Rambabu’s statement that a rowdy sheet will be opened against an IPS officer is unacceptable in a democratic set-up, the association says

title: Activists demand Devadasi survey without condition of age limit
content: The centuries-old practice of dedication of women to temples as Devadasis has been banned in the State since 1982 when the Karnataka Devadasis (Prohibition of Dedication) Act was enacted

title: Govt. offers special package of incentives to Kadapa steel plant
content: The JSW Steel Limited intends to begin construction of first phase of the plant in January 2026 and begin commercial production by April 2029

title: CBI arrests three in cybercrime case
content: During the investigation, the CBI unearthed the entire conspiracy of opening the mule account by the bankers without “proper KYC norms” or “Customer Due Diligence” or “Initial Risk Assessment”

title: Gujarat approves action plan for Artificial Intelligence implementation in governance
content: Implementation will be carried out in phases, starting with the creation of a State-level AI data repository, setting up AI development facilities, and launching pilot projects in selected departments

title: ‘Mughal period saw violence; Britain did not recognise suffering inflicted on colonies’: Michel Danino
content: Michel Danino, IIT Gandhinagar Guest Professor and head of NCERT’s Social Science textbook team, on historical framing in the new class seven and eight textbooks, media criticism, and debates over representation

title: ZSI scientists discover a wolf spider, and four wasp species from West Bengal
content: Piratula acuminata marks the first record of the genus Piratula in India; in a separate study, ZSI researchers identified and described four new species of parasitoid wasps belonging to the genus Idris

title: BRS urges Telangana HC to step in over recurring food poisoning incidents in residential schools
content: Party leaders led by T. Harish Rao visit Uyyalawada where 111 students had taken ill due to suspected food poisoning

title: DRDO pushes for hypersonic edge against evolving air threats
content: Top defence scientists deliberated on the performance of the indigenous hi-tech missile systems such as Akash air-defence, Brahmos, MRSAM, ULPGM, all of which were developed at the missile complex in Hyderabad

title: Muslim hawker assaulted in Meerut; attempt to create fear, says opposition
content: While locals claim the victim was mistaken for a thief, his wife alleged they are being forced to modify the complaint

title: TGSWREIS records 5-year high Inter admission rate at 86.7%
content: Of 19,680 available seats, 17,100 have already been filled; emaining institution-wise vacancies will be filled through spot counselling scheduled for July 31

title: Jammu ‘shoot-out’: J&K Police take suspended policemen to crime site, seize service rifle, victim’s bike
content: Officials said the SIT, headed by a Deputy Superintendent of Police-rank officer, visited the site in Satwari where the incident took place on July 24

title: Mamata launches ‘language movement’, condemns targeting of migrant’s family in Delhi
content: Migrants from West Bengal have been detained in different states like Odisha, Haryana and Delhi on suspicion of being Bangladeshi nationals.

title: Prime Minister Narendra Modi soaks in spiritual experience on his visit to Gangaikonda Cholapuram
content: He offers prayers at the Brihadisvara temple, built by Rajendra Chola I, which is famous for its imposing architecture and exquisite sculptures

title: Op Sindoor: Gogoi leads oppn charge against govt in LS; asks ‘how terrorists reached Pahalgam?’
content: In Parliament, Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi challenged Defence Minister Rajnath Singh regarding the Pahalgam attack, questioning the government's failure to prevent it. Gogoi highlighted unanswered questions about the attack, which claimed 22 lives, and criticized the government's internal security measures.

title: 'They never asked how many enemy aircraft we shot down’ - Rajnath hits out at opposition
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh addressed the Lok Sabha. He criticized the opposition's line of questioning regarding Operation Sindoor. Singh stated their questions did not reflect national sentiment. He emphasized the success of the operation. He confirmed no Indian soldiers were harmed. Singh urged focus on national security. He cautioned against distracting from the morale of the armed forces.

title: Exclusive | Washington's father hits out at selectors: 'One failure and he's dropped'
content: Washington Sundar's match-saving performance in the fourth Test against England has been lauded, but his father expresses concern over inconsistent opportunities. M Sundar highlights his son's past performances, including crucial knocks in Chennai and Ahmedabad, and questions the selection process. He emphasizes Washington's talent and calls for consistent chances across formats, citing instances of being dropped despite delivering impactful performances.

title: Operation Mahadev: 3 terrorists killed in Srinagar; What we know so far
content: In Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, security forces neutralized three terrorists in an intense firefight near Dachigam National Park. The operation, dubbed "Operation Mahadev," follows reports linking the terrorists to the April 22 Pahalgam attack, where numerous tourists and a local resident were killed.

title: What is TCS' bench policy whose first 35-day cycle ended this month
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) employees face increased job insecurity as a new bench policy, limiting unallocated time to 35 days, takes effect. This coincides with TCS announcing plans to cut 12,000 jobs globally due to skill mismatches. The policy, criticized as 'inhumane,' requires upskilling and office presence during bench time, potentially impacting career growth and employment.

title: Historic! 19-yo Divya crowned Women’s WC champion, becomes India’s 88th GM
content: In a stunning victory, 19-year-old Divya Deshmukh clinched the FIDE Women’s World Cup title, defeating India no. 1 Koneru Humpy in rapid tiebreaks in Batumi, Georgia. The 15th seed's remarkable performance saw her overcome formidable opponents. This triumph not only crowns her World Cup Champion but also secures her final Grandmaster norm.

title: Kinetic DX e-scooter launch marks return of legacy nameplate: Price, range, & more
content: Kinetic Engineering's EV arm, Kinetic Watts & Volts, has relaunched in India with the DX EV electric scooter, inspired by the Kinetic Honda DX. Available in two variants, DX and DX+, priced from Rs 1.12 lakh, deliveries begin in September 2025.

title: Bill Gates’ Porsche penalty: Paid $28 every day for 13 years; customs knot untied
content: In 1988, Bill Gates bought a Porsche 959. The car was not legal in the US. It sat in storage for thirteen years. Gates and Steve Wozniak lobbied for change. A new rule allowed import of special cars. Gates finally drove his Porsche. The case changed US car import rules. Now, others benefit from this change.

title: Chess | Divya Deshmukh becomes India's 88th GM - full list of Grandmasters
content: Nineteen-year-old Divya Deshmukh secured the FIDE Women's World Cup in Batumi. She defeated Koneru Humpy in rapid tiebreaks. Divya started as the 15th seed and displayed remarkable skill. Her victory earned her the Grandmaster title. She is the fourth Indian woman to achieve this milestone. This win marks a significant moment in her career.

title: Mother gives skin to save baby: 8-month-old recovers after near-fatal burns in Ahmedabad crash
content: In a harrowing incident following the AI 171 airplane crash, eight-month-old Dhyaansh and his mother, Manisha, suffered severe burns. Manisha's courageous act of saving her child led to both enduring extensive treatment, including skin grafts for Dhyaansh. The dedicated medical team at KD Hospital provided specialized care, ensuring their recovery and eventual discharge, highlighting the strength of a mother's love and medical expertise.

title: Tears of joy! Divya Deshmukh breaks down after winning FIDE Women's World Cup - Watch
content: In a stunning upset, 19-year-old Divya Deshmukh clinched the FIDE Women’s World Cup title, defeating Koneru Humpy in rapid tiebreaks. This victory not only secured her the World Cup but also earned her final Grandmaster norm, making her the fourth Indian woman to achieve the prestigious GM title.

title: Jeff Bezos sells $1.5 bn worth of Amazon shares, now holds stock valued at…
content: Jeff Bezos recently sold 6.6 million Amazon shares worth $1.5 billion, as per an SEC filing. The sales occurred on July 21 and 22, before Amazon's Q2 earnings report. These transactions were executed under a prearranged 10b5-1 trading plan. Bezos intends to sell more shares, potentially up to 25 million by May 2026. He has already sold $4.

title: NHL’s sweethearts Connor McDavid and Lauren Kyle celebrate one year together
content: Connor McDavid and Lauren Kyle are celebrating their first wedding anniversary with romantic throwback photos from their dreamy Muskoka ceremony. The NHL star shared heartfelt moments on Instagram, giving fans a glimpse into their fairytale celebration. With NHL friends like Leon Draisaitl and Celeste Desjardins in attendance, the couple’s love story continues to capture hearts.

title: Monsoon session: Was Tharoor offered a chance to speak on Op Sindoor? What we know
content: Shashi Tharoor's silence on Operation Sindoor sparks debate. Despite leading a delegation after the Pahalgam attack, he declined to speak on the issue in Parliament. Gaurav Gogoi and K Suresh approached him, but Tharoor preferred discussing the Indian Ports Bill, 2025. His endorsement of the government's actions contrasts with the Congress party's stance.

title: All you need to know about Madhampatty Rangaraj’s secret wedding to Joy Crizildaa
content: Madhampatty Rangaraj, actor and chef, recently married fashion designer Joy Crizildaa. Joy is a stylist for Tamil film stars. She previously worked in television before entering fashion. News of her pregnancy came soon after the wedding. Joy was earlier married to director J. J. Frederick. Madhampatty Rangaraj was previously married to Shruti.

title: Arshdeep Singh teases England with 'ho gai teri balle balle' moves after Old Trafford draw
content: India celebrated a moral victory after drawing the fourth Test against England at Old Trafford, highlighted by a resilient batting performance. Pacer Arshdeep Singh, despite being sidelined with an injury, lifted team spirits. A video of him dancing, showing off his Bhangra moves up the stairs went viral, showcasing the team's positive energy.

title: Watch: Divya breaks down in tears, hugs mother after historic World Cup win
content: Divya Deshmukh, a 19-year-old chess prodigy, achieved a stunning victory at the FIDE Women’s World Cup, defeating Koneru Humpy in a thrilling tie-break. This triumph not only secured her the championship but also earned her the coveted Grandmaster title, making her India's fourth woman to reach this milestone.

title: 'Op Sindoor to resume if ... ': Rajnath tells LS how strikes rattled Pak; dismisses 'pressure' charge
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh addressed Parliament regarding Operation Sindoor, the retaliatory strike following the Pahalgam attack. He confirmed the operation successfully targeted terrorist infrastructure, eliminating over 100 individuals, and was paused after achieving its objectives, dismissing claims of external pressure. Singh highlighted India's effective defense systems in thwarting Pakistan's subsequent large-scale attack, ensuring no damage to Indian assets.

title: Divya Deshmukh wins Chess World Cup: How much prize money did she win?
content: In a stunning victory, 19-year-old Diya Deshmukh triumphed over Koneru Humpy at the FIDE Women’s World Cup in Georgia. Deshmukh's composed play under pressure secured her the title and also earned her the prestigious Grandmaster title, making her India's 88th Grandmaster and only the fourth Indian woman to achieve this feat.

title: Stock market crash: BSE Sensex down over 590 points - top 5 reasons for fall
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, extended their losing streak on Monday. While Nifty50 went below 24,650 intraday, BSE Sensex tanked over 700 points.

title: Exclusive! Karisma Kapoor not involved in Sunjay Kapur's 30,000 crore estate
content: Sources close to the Kapur family have confirmed that Karisma Kapoor has no involvement in the inheritance dispute following Sunjay Kapur's death. The actress is not seeking any share of his ₹30,000 crore estate, with her primary concern being the well-being of her children, who are the rightful heirs.

title: Injured Rishabh Pant shares major update after being ruled out
content: Rishabh Pant is ruled out of the final Test against England due to a foot fracture sustained during the fourth Test. Despite the injury, Pant displayed remarkable resilience, scoring a half-century. Coach Gautam Gambhir lauded Pant's character, emphasizing his contribution to the team's foundation. Pant expressed gratitude for the support and shared his recovery plans.

title: 'Switch off our economy?' High commissioner to UK schools journalist on Russian oil
content: Indian High Commissioner Vikram Doraiswami defended India's oil imports from Russia, highlighting the nation's position as the third-largest energy consumer importing over 80% of its needs. He questioned the feasibility of halting the economy and pointed out the hypocrisy of Western nations buying other resources from countries they restrict India from trading with.

title: Bihar SIR: SC asks EC to reconsider Aadhaar and election ID
content: The Supreme Court urged the Election Commission to consider Aadhaar and voter ID cards as valid identity proofs during Bihar's Special Intensive Revision. Petitioners, including ADR, raised concerns about the exercise's legality and potential disenfranchisement, alleging arbitrary practices and violations of constitutional rights. Despite the EC's claims of high voter participation, reports suggest irregularities and potential fraud in the process.

title: IND vs ENG: 'You're not in the battle' - Kevin Pietersen defends Ben Stokes
content: The drawn fourth Test at Old Trafford saw England captain Ben Stokes' frustration boil over as India declined his offer to end play early, with Jadeja and Sundar pursuing centuries. Stokes' actions drew criticism from commentators like Nasser Hussain and Manjrekar, who deemed his behavior 'spoiled.' However, Kevin Pietersen defended Stokes' emotional response, emphasizing the players' mindset and charged atmosphere.

title: TCS layoffs ‘biggest ever’: AI not to blame for ‘difficult’ decision?
content: TCS layoffs: India's IT sector is facing turbulence as TCS, the nation's largest IT firm, announces unprecedented layoffs impacting 2% of its workforce, primarily in middle to senior roles. CEO K Krithivasan cites skill mismatches, not AI, as the reason for this 'difficult decision.

title: Top 6 world's most beautiful airports: See who tops list
content: Yantai Penglai International Airport in China has been declared the world’s most beautiful airport of 2025 by Prix Versailles awards, with its Terminal 2 standing out for its coastal-inspired design and thoughtful architecture. The list also includes airports from France, Japan, and the United States, each recognized for unique design elements and sustainability efforts.

title: NBA legend Stephen Curry admitted seeking words of advice from Barack Obama
content: Stephen Curry, following the NBA tradition of seeking wisdom from influential figures, uniquely reached out to former U.S. President Barack Obama. Curry values Obama's perspective and appreciates his support, both on and off the court. Their connection extends to collaborations with Michelle Obama, highlighting a deep and meaningful partnership beyond basketball.

title: Patiala man kills his only son on grandchild’s birthday
content: In a shocking incident near Patiala, Malkeet Singh allegedly murdered his son, Jagpal, following a heated argument over a pedestal fan. The dispute, which occurred on Jagpal's son's birthday, escalated when Jagpal asked his father to switch off the fan. Malkeet, reportedly intoxicated, attacked Jagpal with a farming tool while he slept.

title: UP hospital staff sedates patient and rapes her during night shift
content: In Balrampur's Pachpedwa, a hospital staff member, Yogesh Pandey, has been arrested for allegedly raping a woman patient after sedating her at a private hospital. Police acted swiftly, apprehending Pandey within 48 hours following a tip-off. The incident occurred on July 25 when the accused, a nursing staff, allegedly sedated and assaulted the woman.

title: IND vs ENG: Stokes breaks silence on his availability : 'Very unlikely...'
content: England captain Ben Stokes expressed uncertainty about playing in the fifth Test against India due to a painful bicep tendon and overall workload. Despite leading the series 2-1, Stokes emphasized the team's desire for one final strong performance at The Oval. He acknowledged the physical toll on the bowling unit and the need for rest before selection.

title: Hyderabad man collapses, dies of heart attack while playing badminton
content: In Hyderabad's Uppal Bhagayath, a 26-year-old man named Rakesh tragically died after collapsing on an indoor badminton court on Sunday evening. CCTV footage showed him actively playing before the sudden fall. Rushed to a nearby hospital, he was declared dead upon arrival, with authorities citing a heart attack as the cause.

title: Virat Kohli's brother takes a dig at Team India: 'We had a Test team'
content: India's bowlers faced criticism after struggling to match England's intensity in the fourth Test at Old Trafford, leading to a significant first-innings deficit. Despite this setback, Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar's resilient centuries in the second innings enabled India to secure a draw, marking their first at the venue in 35 years. England now leads the series 2-1.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ BO collection: Mohit Suri’s film nears Rs 250 cr mark
content: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's 'Saiyaara,' directed by Mohit Suri, is a box office success, nearing Rs 250 crore after a strong second weekend. The film's emotional content and music have resonated with audiences, outperforming major releases. While weekday earnings may dip, 'Saiyaara' aims for Rs 275-300 crore, facing competition from upcoming releases.

title: ‘Shame on those who spread this’: Ashwin dismisses 'fake news’ on India vs Pakistan
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has refuted a fabricated quote circulating online, falsely attributing a controversial statement to him regarding India-Pakistan matches in the World Championship of Legends (WCL) and the Asia Cup. The fake post alleged Ashwin linked financial interest to the cancellation of the WCL match and the continuation of the Asia Cup fixture.

title: 'In this dressing room ... ': Ex-cricketer says Gambhir should take chill pill
content: Sanjay Manjrekar suggests Gautam Gambhir needs to relax and be more open to criticism, particularly regarding Shubman Gill's captaincy and team selections. Manjrekar credits the players' resilience for India's draw against England, questioning Gambhir's tactical decisions and dismissing his defense of Gill's form. He also challenged Gambhir's explanation of Karun Nair's exclusion from the team.

title: UP shocker: Patients treated in torchlight at Ballia hospital
content: A power outage and generator failure plunged Ballia district hospital's emergency room into darkness, forcing medical staff to treat patients under torchlight. The 45-minute blackout occurred on Friday evening, prompting a swift response from health officials. Additional inverters have been installed to prevent future incidents and improve the system's efficiency.

title: 'What’s with the English?' — Karthik, Vaughan weigh in on handshake drama
content: The drawn fourth Test between India and England witnessed heated debate after Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar refused an early draw offer, frustrating England captain Ben Stokes. Dinesh Karthik questioned England's sportsmanship, while Michael Vaughan supported India's decision to allow their batsmen to pursue centuries. With the series at 2-1, the controversy adds fuel to the highly anticipated Oval Test.

title: ‘Don’t resign under pressure….’: TCS layoffs opposed by IT employee unions
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) faces objections from IT employee organizations over its plan to reduce staff by approximately 12,000, impacting middle and senior positions. Unions deem the dismissals unlawful, advising employees to resist resignation pressures.

title: 'Make that call': Ashwin urges Gill to take bold decision for Oval decider
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has advised Shubman Gill to reconsider his bowling strategies before the crucial fifth Test against England at The Oval. Ashwin emphasized that winning Test matches requires a focus on bowlers who can take wickets, rather than relying solely on batting depth.

title: Deadline week update! Rankings for the top 50 MLB trade candidates
content: Our running list of who could be traded has some new names in the final few days before the July 31 deadline.

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Bubble teams could shape week ahead
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on July 31 approaches.

title: Ichiro shows funny side, joins CC, Wagner in HOF
content: Ichiro Suzuki's sense of humor was on full display Sunday, when he joined CC Sabathia, Billy Wagner, Dave Parker and Dick Allen in baseball's Hall of Fame.

title: Sources: Cowboys G Jones has broken neck bone
content: Cowboys guard Rob Jones will be out two to three months after breaking a bone in his neck Sunday at practice, sources told ESPN.

title: Wallace takes Brickyard; 1st Black winner at Indy
content: Bubba Wallace became the first Black driver to win a major race on Indianapolis Motor Speedway's 2.5-mile oval, surviving a late rain delay, two overtimes, concerns over running out of fuel and a hard-charging Kyle Larson on Sunday in the Brickyard 400.

title: Qawi, ex-convict who became champ, dies at 72
content: Dwight Muhammad Qawi, who became a Hall of Fame boxer during a 20-year career following an armed robbery conviction earlier in his life, died at age 72.

title: Jones listens as fans chant 'Pay Micah!' at camp
content: On Saturday, fans chanted "Pay Micah!" in support of star Micah Parsons getting an extension from the Cowboys.

title: Source: Buccaneers rookie Walker out for season
content: Buccaneers rookie edge rusher David Walker has a torn ACL and will miss the season, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Sources: Royals keeping Lugo on 2 years, $46M
content: Seth Lugo, who had been regarded as one of the best potential trade candidates this deadline season, will remain with the Royals on a two-year, $46 million extension, sources told ESPN.

title: 49ers DE Jackson taken off field via ambulance
content: 49ers DE Tarron Jackson was talking and moving his extremities after sustaining an injury during Sunday's practice.

title: 'Everybody just died laughing': Teammates, opponents on what makes Ichiro a Hall of Fame icon
content: As a Mariners icon gets his Cooperstown call, teammates and opponents share what makes him 100% Hall of Fame worthy.

title: Pérez: What it was like to play with three 2025 HOFers
content: Eduardo Pérez believes this year's inductees are more than great players -- their hearts and characters stand out.

title: Can Ashton Jeanty deliver on the hype? Those who've watched his career have no doubt
content: Jeanty started turning heads as a 14-year-old in Naples, Italy. His coaches, teammates and even his opponents have been witnesses to his rise.

title: Who will start for the Browns and Colts in Week 1? We made QB battle predictions
content: We talked to sources to help project open QB1 races in Cleveland, Indianapolis, New Orleans and New York.

title: We graded every NBA team's offseason: Which teams got an A and which got an F?
content: Kevin Pelton hands out offseason grades for each of the NBA's 30 teams. Who passed, and who scraped by? la

title: Don't stop believing: The inside story of how England won Euro 2025
content: Late heroics, Reggie the dog and a new team mantra. Here's the inside story of how England won the 2025 European Championship.

title: Cameo guide: PGA stars, NFL champ, WWE icons and more
content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

title: Return to your happy place: How Happy Gilmore's long-awaited sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

title: Clay's Playbook: A game plan for your draft day
content: Mike Clay goes position by position and lays out a successful approach for 2025 fantasy football drafts.

title: UFC Abu Dhabi takeaways: Why Whittaker's loss is good for the middleweight division
content: What does Reinier de Ridder's win mean for the middleweight division? Brett Okamoto provides takeaways.

title: Can Florida repeat? How good will BYU be? Our men's hoops preview 100 days out
content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

title: All-SEC Final Four? 100 predictions, more at 100 days until women's hoops
content: From the biggest storylines to the top players to watch, we preview the 2025-26 women's basketball season.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

title: Woad, 21, wins Scottish Open in debut as pro
content: Two weeks ago, Lottie Woad was the world's No. 1 amateur. On Sunday, the 21-year-old Englishwoman became an LPGA Tour champion in her professional debut.

title: NBA summer storylines we're still watching, including the Kuminga saga at Golden State
content: The NBA's offseason flurry is winding down, but key restricted free agent and superstar extension decisions are still looming.

title: Reactions to MLB trade deadline deals
content: Track the fantasy fallout from all the key deals as we head towards the MLB trade deadline on Thursday, July 31.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Nusa, Fofana if Rodrygo move fails
content: Liverpool are prioritizing a move for Real Madrid winger Rodrygo but have other options. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: 14 Days, 1 Mission, Mahadev Peak: How Pahalgam Mastermind Was Hunted Down
content: The security forces in Jammu and Kashmir avenged the Pahalgam attack today after hunting down the mastermind, Suleiman Shah, alias Hashim Musa, in an encounter in Srinagar.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Draw That Hurt More Than Defeat - Ask Ben Stokes
content: There is a winner in this contest; there is that last man standing; someone did indeed have the last laugh. If you are fighting for survival, that is the kind of cut that you want to inflict. And that is what Team India did at Old Trafford.

title: "Come Back": Mamata Banerjee Says Bengalis Facing Atrocities Outside State
content: Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has alleged that Bengalis are facing "atrocities" outside Bengal -- especially in BJP-ruled states -- and urged them to "come back".

title: Syria To Hold Parliamentary Elections In September, 1st Since Bashar Al-Assad's Regime Fall
content: Syria will hold parliamentary elections in September, the head of a body tasked with organising the election process told state media Sunday.

title: Trump's Golf Course To "Further" UK-US Relations? President To Meet PM Starmer
content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer is meeting Monday with Trump at a golf property owned by the president's family near Turnberry in southwestern Scotland.

title: 4 Dead, 8 Missing As Heavy Rain Hits China, Highest Level Flood Alert Issued
content: Heavy rain intensified around Beijing and nearby provinces on Monday, with 4 people killed in a landslide in northern Hebei and 8 people missing, as authorities warned of intensifying conditions and heightened disaster risks in the coming days.

title: Country Wanted "Operation Tandoor", Not Sindoor: Samajwadi Party MP In Lok Sabha
content: Samajwadi Party MP Ramashankar Rajbhar on Monday said in Lok Sabha that the country wanted "Operation Tandoor" after the Pahalgam terror attack to roast the terrorist responsible for it, and not Operation Sindoor.

title: 6-Year-Old Killed, Teacher Injured After Slab Holding School Gate Collapses In Rajasthan
content: A six-year-old student was killed and a teacher injured when a pillar of the main gate of a government school building collapsed in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer district on Monday.

title: Pahalgam Mastermind Suleiman Shah Was Ex Commando Of Pak Army's Elite Unit
content: After three months and six days, the security forces hunted down the mastermind of a terrorist attack in which 26 civilians were shot dead in the Baisaran valley of Pahalgam on April 22.

title: 'Can We Call Op Sindoor A Success If...': Congress vs Centre In Lok Sabha
content: Parliament saw a fierce face-off between the Centre and the Opposition during a marathon discussion on Operation Sindoor - launched against terror bases in Pakistan in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Tata Consultancy Services' Shares Drop After Layoff Announcement
content: Shares of tech major Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) were trading lower on Monday, following the company's announcement to lay off around 12,200 employees in FY26.

title: The UN, Palestinians, Israel And A Hope For Two-State Solution
content: Ever since the partition of Palestine into Jewish and Arab states in 1947, the United Nations has been inextricably linked to the fate of Palestinians, with the organization meeting this week hoping to revive the two-state solution.

title: Bangladesh Offers To Buy Boeing Planes In Hopes Of Lower US Tariffs
content: Bangladesh has offered to buy 25 jets from Boeing Co., using the recent US-Indonesia trade deal as a model, in hopes of persuading President Donald Trump to lower tariffs on the country.

title: 'Name: Dog Babu, Father: Kutta Babu': A Residence Certificate In Bihar
content: In yet another vindication of social media wisdom that Bihar is "not for beginners", a cute, smiling Golden Retriever with an unimaginative name, Dog Babu, managed to get a residence certificate during the ongoing voter review in the poll-bound state

title: Thailand, Cambodia Agree To 'Unconditional' Ceasefire
content: Thailand and Cambodia will enter into an unconditional ceasefire starting at midnight on Monday, Malaysia's Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim announced

title: Lionel Messi Attends Concert With Wife Antonela Amid Recent Coldplay Fiasco
content: Football star Lionel Messi made a surprising arrival at a Coldplay concert last weekend at a concert that was held at Miami's Hard Rock Stadium in Miami and which drew a massive crowd of fans.

title: 28-Day-Old Infant Sold By Parents For Rs 20,000; Rescued By Odisha Police
content: Police in Odisha's Bolangir district on Monday rescued a 28-day-old baby girl who was allegedly sold by her parents for Rs 20,000 due to extreme poverty, officials said.

title: 2 Siblings, On Way To School, Killed After Cycle Gets Hit By Vehicle In UP: Cops
content: Two siblings on the way to school here on Monday died and a third child received critical injuries when their cycles was hit by an unknown vehicle, police said on Monday.
